name: Kth Largest Element in a Stream

similar_questions.title: Kth Largest Element in an Array

title: Kth Largest Element in a Stream
content:
You are part of a university admissions office and need to keep track of the kth highest test score from applicants in real-time. This helps to determine cut-off marks for interviews and admissions dynamically as new applicants submit their scores.

You are tasked to implement a class which, for a given integer k, maintains a stream of test scores and continuously returns the kth highest test score after a new score has been submitted. More specifically, we are looking for the kth highest score in the sorted list of all scores.

Implement the KthLargest class:

  • KthLargest(int k, int[] nums) Initializes the object with the integer k and the stream of test scores nums.
  • int add(int val) Adds a new test score val to the stream and returns the element representing the kth largest element in the pool of test scores so far.

 

Example 1:

Input:
["KthLargest", "add", "add", "add", "add", "add"]
[[3, [4, 5, 8, 2]], [3], [5], [10], [9], [4]]

Output: [null, 4, 5, 5, 8, 8]

Explanation:

KthLargest kthLargest = new KthLargest(3, [4, 5, 8, 2]);
kthLargest.add(3); // return 4
kthLargest.add(5); // return 5
kthLargest.add(10); // return 5
kthLargest.add(9); // return 8
kthLargest.add(4); // return 8

Example 2:

Input:
["KthLargest", "add", "add", "add", "add"]
[[4, [7, 7, 7, 7, 8, 3]], [2], [10], [9], [9]]

Output: [null, 7, 7, 7, 8]

Explanation:

KthLargest kthLargest = new KthLargest(4, [7, 7, 7, 7, 8, 3]);
kthLargest.add(2); // return 7
kthLargest.add(10); // return 7
kthLargest.add(9); // return 7
kthLargest.add(9); // return 8

 

Constraints:

  • 0 <= nums.length <= 104
  • 1 <= k <= nums.length + 1
  • -104 <= nums[i] <= 104
  • -104 <= val <= 104
  • At most 104 calls will be made to add.

discussion_posts.name: Arv93
discussion_posts.content: Can someone help me in understanding the problem statement?

discussion_posts.name: jizhijizhi
discussion_posts.content:
At the very beginning, k = 3, the array is [4, 5, 8, 2].
After kthLargest.add(3);  the array is [4, 5, 8, 2, 3], after sorting, the array is [2,3,4,5,8], we count backwards of the array, 3rd largest is 4,  it returns 4.
After kthLargest.add(5); the array is [4, 5, 8, 2, 3, 5], after sorting, the array is[2,3,4,5,5,8], we count backwards of the array, 3rd largest is 5, it returns 5.
After kthLargest.add(10); the array is [4, 5, 8, 2, 3, 5, 10], after sorting, the array is[2,3,4,5,5,8,10], we count backwards of the array, 3rd largest is 5, it returns 5.
After kthLargest.add(9); the array is [4, 5, 8, 2, 3, 5, 10, 9], after sorting, the array is[2,3,4,5,5,8, 9,10], we count backwards of the array, 3rd largest is 8, it returns 8.
After kthLargest.add(4); the array is [4, 5, 8, 2, 3, 5, 10, 9, 4], after sorting, the array is[2,3,4,4,5,5,8, 9,10], we count backwards of the array, 3rd largest is 8, it returns 8.

discussion_posts.name: everetty2k
discussion_posts.content: Title says it all. Poorly worded and confusing.

discussion_posts.name: Shouvik_Barua
discussion_posts.content: is it just me? or the problem statement is poorly written?

discussion_posts.name: ptk_trindade
discussion_posts.content: Why is this marked as easy? I feel like I\'m overengineering...

discussion_posts.name: Tamaki_Mari
discussion_posts.content:
hello there!

please tell me if i have understood it:
so basically we have some numbers and every time we add a number, we have to show which is the kth largest? does that make sense?

discussion_posts.name: breakout
discussion_posts.content:
`You may assume that nums length ≥ k-1 and k ≥ 1.`

So I've heard.

But some test cases still has `nums = []`. And you get `index out of range` by not checking for `len(heap)` inside `add` method.

discussion_posts.name: MayankDw
discussion_posts.content:
Given array is [4,5,8,2] and k =3. Find kth Largest element .

Add 3 then find kth largest element. 
sorted array after adding 3, [2,3,4,5,8] --> Kth i.e. 3rd largest element is 4
Add 5
sorted array [2,3,4,5,5,8] --> 3rd largest element is 5
Add 10
sorted array [2,3,4,5,5,8,10] --> 3rd largest element is 5
Add 9
sorted array [2,3,4,5,5,8,910] --> 3rd largest element is 8
Add 4
sorted array [2,3,4,4,5,5,8,910] --> 3rd largest element is 8

discussion_posts.name: aaronclong
discussion_posts.content: I don\'t undertstand what the constructor\'s `int k` parameter is suppossed to be. I find it very confusing and the discription doesn\'t point it out either.

discussion_posts.name: aodihis
discussion_posts.content:
Don't forget to anticipate empty list and list less than k, example:

```
["KthLargest","add","add","add","add","add"]
[[3,[4,2]],[1],[1],[-1],[3],[4]]
["KthLargest","add","add","add","add","add"]
[[1,[]],[2],[1],[-1],[3],[4]]
```
